summary: The Tribal Trust Land Homeownership Act of 2025 aims to streamline the processing of mortgages on Indian land. It mandates the Bureau of Indian Affairs (BIA) to meet specific deadlines for reviewing and approving mortgage packages, including residential, business, and land mortgages, and right-of-way documents. The bill defines key terms, requires the BIA to provide timely notices regarding processing, grants access to relevant agencies to the Trust Asset and Accounting Management System (TAAMS), mandates annual reports, and commissions a Government Accountability Office (GAO) study. It also establishes a Realty Ombudsman position to ensure compliance and act as a liaison.
